00001 #include "Lgm/Lgm_MagModelInfo.h"
00002 #define JUMP_METHOD 1

00010 /*
00011  *   This routine evaluates the "Sb integral" from mirror point to
00012  *   mirror point. Instead of tracing the whole field line, this version allows
00013  *   the Quadpack integration routine to evaluate B(s). The hope is that this
00014  *   will decrease the amount of tracing needed to evaluate the integral. It may
00015  *   very well be slower than tracing the whole line and then doing the integral,
00016  *   but we'll try this for comparison ... The other obvious way to do it is to
00017  *   pre-trace the FL and then interpolate the points in some manner. I'm hoping
00018  *   that combining dqags and Bulirsch-Stoer (which are both extrapolation methods)
00019  *   that we'll get a speedup.
00020  *   
00021  *   The integral is as follows:
00022  *
00023  *
00024  *                          / sm_north       
00025  *                         |                 [                ] (-1/2)
00026  *                         |                 [        B(s)    ]
00027  *                 Sb  =   |                 [ 1 -  --------  ]        ds
00028  *                         |                 [         Bm     ]
00029  *                         |                 [                ]
00030  *                        / sm_south
00031  *                       
00032  *
00033  *  I think these are all now reentrant.
00034  *
00035  */
00036 double SbIntegral( Lgm_MagModelInfo *fInfo ) {
00037 
00038 
00039     double  a, b;
00040     double  epsabs, epsrel, result, abserr;
00041     int     npts, key, neval, ier, leniw, lenw, last, iwork[501];
00042     double  work[2001], points[20];
00043     _qpInfo *qpInfo;
00044 
00045 
00046     /*
00047      *  Type-cast our data structure to a generic type.
00048      *  The structure holds auzilliary info we need down 
00049      *  in the function calls.
00050      */
00051     qpInfo = (_qpInfo *)fInfo;
00052 
00053 
00054 
00055     /*
00056      *  Limits of integration.
00057      */
00058     a = 0.0;
00059     b = fInfo->Sm_North - fInfo->Sm_South;
00060 
00061 
00062 
00063     /*
00064      *   set tolerances. 
00065      */
00066     //epsabs = fInfo->epsabs;
00067     //epsrel = fInfo->epsrel;
00068     epsabs = fInfo->Lgm_Sb_Integrator_epsabs;
00069     epsrel = fInfo->Lgm_Sb_Integrator_epsrel;
00070 
00071     /*
00072      *  Init some vars used in Sb_integrand() (these are not declared static in
00073      *  Sb_integrand() in order to avoid making it non-reentrant).
00074      */
00075     fInfo->Lgm_Sb_integrand_S        = 0.0;
00076     fInfo->Lgm_Sb_integrand_FirstCall = TRUE;
00077                                                                                                                                                                              
00078 
00079 
00080     leniw = 500; 
00081     lenw  = 4*leniw; 
00082     key   = 6;
00083     //iwork  = (int *) calloc( limit+1, sizeof(int) );
00084     //work   = (double *) calloc( lenw+1, sizeof(double) );
00085     //
00086     points[1] = a;
00087     points[2] = b;
00088     npts = 4;
00089     dqagp(Sb_integrand, qpInfo, a, b, npts, points, epsabs, epsrel, &result, &abserr, &neval, &ier, leniw, lenw, &last, iwork, work);
00090     //free( iwork );
00091     //free( work );
00092 
00093     //dqk21(Sb_integrand, qpInfo, a, b, &result, &abserr, &resabs, &resasc);
00094 
00095 
00096     return( result );
00097 
00098 }

00101 double SbIntegral_interped( Lgm_MagModelInfo *fInfo ) {

00104     double  a, b;

00106     int     npts, key, neval, ier, leniw, lenw, last, iwork[501];
00107     double  work[2001], points[20];
00108     _qpInfo *qpInfo;
00109 
00110 
00111     /*
00112      *  Type-cast our data structure to a generic type.
00113      *  The structure holds auzilliary info we need down 
00114      *  in the function calls.
00115      */
00116     qpInfo = (_qpInfo *)fInfo;
00117 
00118 
00119 
00120     /*
00121      *  Limits of integration.
00122      */

00124     b = fInfo->Sm_North;
00125     //printf("\n\n\nSbIntegral_interped: a, b = %g %g\n", a, b);
00126 
00127 
00128 
00129     /*
00130      *   set tolerances.

00136

00141

00146     dqagp(Sb_integrand_interped, qpInfo, a, b, npts, points, epsabs, epsrel, &result, &abserr, &neval, &ier, leniw, lenw, &last, iwork, work);
00147 
00148     return( result );
00149 
00150 }

00154 double Sb_integrand_interped( double s, _qpInfo *qpInfo ) {
00155 
00156     double              B, g, f;
00157     Lgm_MagModelInfo    *fInfo;
00158     /*
00159      *  Get pointer to our auxilliary data structure.
00160      */
00161     fInfo = (Lgm_MagModelInfo *)qpInfo;
00162 
00163     B = BofS( s, fInfo );
00164     g = 1.0 - B/fInfo->Bm;
00165     f = (g > 0.0) ? sqrt( g ) : 0.0;
00166     ++fInfo->Lgm_n_Sb_integrand_Calls;
00167 
00168     return( (f==0.0) ? 0.0 : 1.0/f );
00169 
00170 }
00171 
00172 
00173 
00174 double Sb_integrand( double s, _qpInfo *qpInfo ) {
00175 
00176 
00177     //static double     S=0.0;
00178     //static Lgm_Vector P, u_scale;
00179     Lgm_Vector          Bvec;
00180     int                 reset=1, done, Count;
00181     double              f, g, Hdone, H, Htry, Hdid, Hnext, sgn=1.0, sdid, B, dS;
00182     Lgm_MagModelInfo    *fInfo;
00183 
00184 
00185 
00186     /*
00187      *  Get pointer to our auxilliary data structure.
00188      */
00189     fInfo = (Lgm_MagModelInfo *)qpInfo;
00190 
00191 
00192 
00193     if ( JUMP_METHOD == 0 ) {
00194 
00195         /*
00196          *  Set starting point.
00197          *  If this is the first call for this integral, set point
00198          *  to the lower limit.
00199          */
00200         if ( fInfo->Lgm_Sb_integrand_FirstCall  == TRUE ) {
00201             fInfo->Lgm_Sb_integrand_FirstCall = FALSE;
00202             fInfo->Lgm_Sb_integrand_u_scale.x =  10.0;  fInfo->Lgm_Sb_integrand_u_scale.y = 1.0; fInfo->Lgm_Sb_integrand_u_scale.z = 10.0;
00203             fInfo->Lgm_Sb_integrand_P = fInfo->Pm_South;
00204             dS = s;
00205             fInfo->Lgm_Sb_integrand_S = 0.0;
00206         } else {
00207             dS = s - fInfo->Lgm_Sb_integrand_S;
00208         }
00209 
00210         if (dS < 0.0) {
00211             H = -dS; sgn = -1.0;
00212         } else {
00213             H = dS; sgn = 1.0;
00214         }
00215         //printf("1. dS, s, H S = %g %g %g %g\n", dS, s, H, fInfo->Lgm_Sb_integrand_S);
00216 
00217     } else {
00218 
00219         /*
00220          *  this strategy starts at start each time.
00221          *  Seems to limit roundoff error from accumulating?
00222          */
00223         if ( fInfo->Lgm_Sb_integrand_FirstCall  == TRUE ) {
00224             fInfo->Lgm_Sb_integrand_FirstCall = FALSE;
00225         }
00226         fInfo->Lgm_Sb_integrand_u_scale.x =  10.0;  fInfo->Lgm_Sb_integrand_u_scale.y = 1.0; fInfo->Lgm_Sb_integrand_u_scale.z = 10.0;
00227         fInfo->Lgm_Sb_integrand_P = fInfo->Pm_South;
00228         H = s; sgn = 1.0;
00229  
00230     }
00231 
00232 
00233 
00234 
00235 
00236 
00237 
00238 
00239     /*
00240      *  Get B-field at the given value of s. 
00241      *  Need to advance along field line by an amount Htry. May need to 
00242      *  do more than one call to get there...
00243      */
00244     done = FALSE; Count = 0; Htry = H; Hdone = 0.0; reset = 1;
00245     if (Htry < 1e-12) done = TRUE;
00246     while ( !done ) {
00247 
00248         Lgm_MagStep( &fInfo->Lgm_Sb_integrand_P, &fInfo->Lgm_Sb_integrand_u_scale, Htry, &Hdid, &Hnext, 1.0e-7, sgn, &sdid, &reset, fInfo->Bfield, fInfo );
00249         fInfo->Lgm_Sb_integrand_S += sgn*Hdid;
00250         Hdone += Hdid;
00251         if ( (Htry < 1e-12) || fabs(Hdone-H) < 1e-12 ){
00252             done = TRUE;
00253         } else {
00254             Htry = H - Hdone;
00255         }
00256         ++Count;
00257 
00258     }
00259     //printf("H = %g , Htry = %g Hdid = %g  Hnext = %g  Hdone = %g Count = %d P = %g %g %g\n", H, Htry, Hdid, Hnext, Hdone, Count, P.x, P.y, P.z);
00260     //printf("2. dS, s, Hdone S = %g %g %g %g    Count = %d\n", dS, s, Hdone, fInfo->Lgm_Sb_integrand_S, Count);
00261 
00262     fInfo->Bfield( &fInfo->Lgm_Sb_integrand_P, &Bvec, fInfo );
00263     B = Lgm_Magnitude( &Bvec );
00264 
00265     g = 1.0 - B/fInfo->Bm;
00266     f = (g > 0.0) ? sqrt( g ) : 0.0;
00267 
00268     ++fInfo->Lgm_n_Sb_integrand_Calls;
00269 
00270 //printf("Sb_integrand: s = %g  f = %g   g = %g  B = %g    Info->Pm_South = %g %g %g   P = %g %g %g\n", s, f, g, B, fInfo->Pm_South.x, fInfo->Pm_South.y, fInfo->Pm_South.z, fInfo->Lgm_Sb_integrand_P.x, fInfo->Lgm_Sb_integrand_P.y, fInfo->Lgm_Sb_integrand_P.z);
00271     if ( f == 0.0 ) {
00272         return( 0.0 );
00273     } else {
00274         return( 1.0/f );
00275     }
00276 
00277 
00278 }
